creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: two lines of light, delicate calligraphy on richly decorated paper; blue fibers in paper arranged to give the appearance of mountains in lower half; two wide swaths of black washed over the blue fibers in center of lower half give appearance of clouds or fog; narrower black line with gradient near bottom; narrow black line at center; with light tan bands of fibers arranged to give appearance of mountains or clouds at top; two similar black swaths across top give appearance of fog or clouds; another narrower black line with gradient at top
markings: on back: across top center, black pen: [Chikuden]; URC, in red, Japanese inscription; and various, URC
title: Waka
